_info_description.iso_639_3_eng:
This field contains a *descriptors selection rule* that determines which *set* of *descriptors* must be *included* in the *data structure definition* of the *object* for it to be considered *valid*.

The *data type* of the selection *values* must be the *global identifier* of the *descriptors* that must be *included* in the *object data structure*.

In order for the *object data structure* to be *valid*, its *properties* must *include* the *elements* of this *selection*.

_info_examples.iso_639_3_eng:
```json
{
    "_rule_selection-descriptors_one": [one, two, three],
    "_rule_selection-descriptors_any": [red, green, blue],
    "_rule_selection-descriptors_all": [mon. tue, wed]
}
```

This selection rule implies the following conditions:

- At least *one* of `[red, green, blue]` is required.
- *One* or *more* of `[odd, even] `are required.
- *All* of `[mon, tue, wed]` are required.
  

The following are valid:

- `[red, even, mon, tue, wed]`  
- `[green, odd, mon, tue, wed]` 
- `[blue, odd, even, mon, tue, wed]`
  

The following are invalid:

- `[even, mon, tue, wed]` 
- `[green, mon, tue, wed]`
- `[blue, odd, even, tue, wed]`

_info_description.iso_639_3_eng:
This field contains a *terms selection rule* that determines which *set* of *descriptors* are *recommended* to be *included* in the *data structure definition* of the *object*.

The *data type* of the selection *values* must be the *global identifier* of the *descriptors* that are *recommended* to be *included* in the *object data structure*.

The selection of properties is *not required*, it is *optional*, but it is *preferrable* to *include it*.

_info_examples.iso_639_3_eng:
```json
{
    "_rule_selection-descriptors_one": [one, two, three],
    "_rule_selection-descriptors_any": [red, green, blue],
    "_rule_selection-descriptors_all": [mon. tue, wed]
}
```

This selection rule implies the following conditions:

- At least *one* of `[red, green, blue]` is required.
- *One* or *more* of `[odd, even] `are required.
- *All* of `[mon, tue, wed]` are required.
  

The following are valid:

- `[red, even, mon, tue, wed]`  
- `[green, odd, mon, tue, wed]` 
- `[blue, odd, even, mon, tue, wed]`
  

The following are invalid:

- `[even, mon, tue, wed]` 
- `[green, mon, tue, wed]`
- `[blue, odd, even, tue, wed]`

_info_description.iso_639_3_eng:
This field contains a set of *descriptors* that should *not* be *included* in the *data structure definition* of the *object.

The *data type* of the set *values* must be the *global identifier* of the *descriptors*.

In order for the *object data structure* to be *valid*, its *properties* *must not include* the *elements* of this *set*.

This rule should be evaluated at the *end* of the *validation workflow* and should *not trigger* an *error*: all banned properties should simply be *removed*.
This field contains the list of *properties* that are automatically *computed*, their value is *calculated* before *storing* the *record*.
This field contains the list of *properties* that are considered *read nnly*, their value can only be *displayed*. This behaviour also extends to nested object properties.

This field contains the list of *properties* that are considered *Iimmutable*, once the record has been stored, their value cannot be *modified or removed*. This behaviour also extends to nested object properties.

_info_definition.iso_639_3_eng: List of properties with default values.

_info_description.iso_639_3_eng:
This field is a *key/value dictionary* in which the *key* is the *property name*, which is the *global identifier* of the *descriptor*, and the *value* represents the *default value* for that *property*.

The data container and type of the default value should coincide with the descriptor's definition, or the object validation should always fail, since the default value is not valid.

_info_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Selection should contain one term from the set.

_info_description.iso_639_3_eng:
The rule determines that *one* of the terms in the *set* should be part of the *selection*.

The *terms* of the *set* are represented by their *global identifiers*.

_info_examples.iso_639_3_eng: `{ _rule_selection-terms_one: [red, green, blue] }`: The selection must contain `red`, `green`, or `blue`.

_info_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Selection should contain one or more terms from the set.

_info_description.iso_639_3_eng:
The rule determines that *one* or *more* of the terms in the *set* should be part of the *selection*.

The *terms* of the *set* are represented by their *global identifiers*.

_info_examples.iso_639_3_eng: `{ _rule_selection-terms_any: [red, green, blue] }`: The selection must contain `red`, `red` and `green`, or `red`, `green` and `blue`.

_info_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Selection should contain all terms from the set.

_info_description.iso_639_3_eng:
The rule determines that *all* of the terms in the *set* should be part of the *selection*.

TThe *terms* of the *set* are represented by their *global identifiers*.

_info_examples.iso_639_3_eng: `{ _rule_selection-terms_all: [red, green, blue] }`: The selection must contain `red`, `green`, and `blue`.

_info_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Selection should contain one descriptor from the set.

_info_description.iso_639_3_eng:
The rule determines that *one* of the descriptors in the *set* should be part of the *selection*.

The *descriptors* of the *set* are represented by their *global identifiers*.

_info_examples.iso_639_3_eng: `{ _rule_selection-descriptors_one: [red, green, blue] }`: The selection must contain `red`, `green`, or `blue`.

_info_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Selection should contain one or more descriptors from the set.

_info_description.iso_639_3_eng:
The rule determines that *one* or *more* of the descriptors in the *set* should be part of the *selection*.

The *descriptors* of the *set* are represented by their *global identifiers*.

_info_examples.iso_639_3_eng: `{ _rule_selection-descriptors_any: [red, green, blue] }`: The selection must contain `red`, `red` and `green`, or `red`, `green` and `blue`.

_info_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Selection should contain all descriptors from the set.

_info_description.iso_639_3_eng:
The rule determines that *all* of the descriptors in the *set* should be part of the *selection*.

TThe *descriptors* of the *set* are represented by their *global identifiers*.

_info_examples.iso_639_3_eng: `{ _rule_selection-descriptors_all: [red, green, blue] }`: The selection must contain `red`, `green`, and `blue`.

_info_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Selection should contain one value from the set.

_info_description.iso_639_3_eng:
The rule determines that *one* of the values in the *set* should be part of the *selection*.

The *values* of the *set* can be of any data type: when used in the *default property value* of an *object data structure definition*, the *value type* should be the *same* as the *descriptor data type*.

_info_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Selection should contain one or more values from the set.

_info_description.iso_639_3_eng:
The rule determines that *one* or *more* of the values in the *set* should be part of the *selection*.

The *values* of the *set* can be of any data type: when used in the *default property value* of an *object*'s *data structure definition*, the *value type* should be the *same* as the *descriptor data type*.

_info_examples.iso_639_3_eng: `{ _rule_selection-values_one: [1, 2, 3] }`: The selection must contain `1`, `1` and `2`, or `1`, `2`, and `3`.

_info_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Selection should contain all values from the set.

_info_description.iso_639_3_eng:
The rule determines that *all* of the values in the *set* should be part of the *selection*.

The *values* of the *set* can be of any data type: when used in the *default property value* of an *object*'s *data structure definition*, the *value type* should be the *same* as the *descriptor data type*.
